You are encouraged to copy, reproduce, adapt, alter, or otherwise make use of this translation in any way you wish. Attribution is appreciated but not legally required.

segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 35
segments.en: Linked Discourses 35

segments.pli: 14. Devadahavagga
segments.en: 14. At Devadaha

segments.pli: 138. Paṭhamanatumhākasutta
segments.en: 138. Not Yours (1st)

segments.pli: “Yaṃ, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ taṃ pajahatha.
segments.en: “Mendicants, give up what’s not yours.

segments.pli: Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.

segments.pli: Kiñca, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ?
segments.en: And what isn’t yours?

segments.pli: Cakkhu, bhikkhave, na tumhākaṃ; taṃ pajahatha.
segments.en: The eye isn’t yours: give it up.

segments.pli: Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati … pe …
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.

segments.pli: jivhā na tumhākaṃ; taṃ pajahatha.
segments.en: The ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: Sā vo pahīnā hitāya sukhāya bhavissati … pe …
mano na tumhākaṃ; taṃ pajahatha.
segments.en: mind isn’t yours: give it up.

segments.pli: So vo pahīno hitāya sukhāya bhavissati.
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.

segments.pli: Seyyathāpi, bhikkhave, yaṃ imasmiṃ jetavane tiṇakaṭṭhasākhāpalāsaṃ taṃ jano hareyya vā ḍaheyya vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā kareyya, api nu tumhākaṃ evamassa:
segments.en: Suppose a person was to carry off the grass, sticks, branches, and leaves in this Jeta’s Grove, or burn them, or do what they want with them. Would you think:

segments.pli: ‘amhe jano harati vā ḍahati vā yathāpaccayaṃ vā karotī’”ti?
segments.en: ‘This person is carrying us off, burning us, or doing what they want with us?’”

segments.pli: “No hetaṃ, bhante”.
segments.en: “No, sir.

segments.pli: “Taṃ kissa hetu”?
segments.en: Why is that?

segments.pli: “Na hi no etaṃ, bhante, attā vā attaniyaṃ vā”ti.
segments.en: Because that’s neither self nor belonging to self.”

segments.pli: “Evameva kho, bhikkhave, cakkhu na tumhākaṃ; taṃ pajahatha.
segments.en: “In the same way, the eye isn’t yours: give it up.

segments.pli: Taṃ vo pahīnaṃ hitāya sukhāya bhavissati … pe …
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.

segments.pli: jivhā na tumhākaṃ; taṃ pajahatha.
segments.en: The ear … nose … tongue … body …

segments.pli: Sā vo pahīnā hitāya sukhāya bhavissati … pe …
mano na tumhākaṃ; taṃ pajahatha.
segments.en: mind isn’t yours: give it up.

segments.pli: So vo pahīno hitāya sukhāya bhavissatī”ti.
segments.en: Giving it up will be for your welfare and happiness.”

segments.pli: Pañcamaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Let go of what is not yours: the six interior sense fields. You wouldn’t be upset if someone took the grass and sticks from the monastery grounds, so why worry over the senses?
